IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To promote the skills, culture and traditions of the traveling circus, and to inspire youth to engage in life-changing adventures in the circus arts.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To promote the skills, culture and traditions of the traveling circus, and to inspire youth to engage in life-changing adventures in the circus arts.
IRS990.Desc: Circus Smirkus conducts a variety of summer circus arts camps, from two days to two weeks, from beginner to advanced, in its own recently constructed facility in Greensboro, Vermont.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: For two months each summer, a company of "Smirkus Troupers" aged 10 to 18, selected by audition and backed by coaches, cooks, crew and musicians, tour New England performing to appreciative audiences in Circus Smirkus' 750-seat, European-style, one-ring, big top tent.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Circus Smirkus subcontracts with circus arts educators to conduct one and two week long artist-in-residency programs in schools throughout New England.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Endowment fund earnings are to be used to fund scholarships for tour troupers and campers.

The Organization is exempt from federal and state income tax under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code. Accordingly, no provision for income taxes has been recorded in the financial statements. Tax-exempt organizations could be required to record an obligation for income taxes as the result of a tax position they have historically taken on various tax exposure items including unrelated business income or tax status. Under guidance issued by the Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB), assets and liabilities are established for uncertain tax positions taken or positions expected to be taken in income tax returns when such positions are judged to not meet the "more-likely-than-not" threshold, based upon the technical merits of the position. The Organization has evaluated the position taken on its filed tax returns. The Organization has not taken, nor does it expect to take any uncertain tax positions in any income tax return.

Circus Smirkus has long been committed to making circus programs available for as many children as possible, regardless of ability to pay. A limited number of partial scholarships are available to families with low incomes or other financial circumstances. Scholarship applicants are reviewed by an oversight committee, and families are welcome to apply for a scholarship without registering a camper. For registration questions please email camp@smirkus.org or read our terms and conditions (available online on the Circus Barn website). Notifications of scholarship awards are made in the spring.

Due to financial and cash constraints brought on by the pandemic, the Organization entered into borrowing arrangements with certain current and former board members to provide the Organization with liquidity to meet its expenditure needs. The loans bear interest at 0% and are due to be paid back to the individuals listed in Schedule L, Part II in consecutive yearly installments beginning in 2023 through 2025.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Explanation for Filing of Amended Return
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: For its year ending December 31, 2022, the Organization compliantly filed its 2022 Form 990 with the IRS before the extended due date of 11-15-2023. However, subsequent to this filing,

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Form 990 is prepared by an outside independent accountant. A draft of the Form 990 is reviewed by management and the board finance committee prior to filing with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The conflict of interest policy is reviewed annually. Any potential conflicts are discussed and the board member does not participate in the discussion or vote if there is a conflict.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Executive Director's salary was determined by the full board, taking into account compensation in previous years, comparative executive salary data, and the overall budget.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available to the public upon request.

For its year ending December 31, 2022, the Organization compliantly filed its 2022 Form 990 with the IRS before the extended due date of 11-15-2023. However, subsequent to this filing, the Organization found that the data used to prepare the original filing inadvertently overstated donations from certain disqualified persons as well as the total contributions received from donors who gave greater than $5,000 during this tax year. Accordingly, the Organization determined that the amounts reported on Schedule A, Part III, Line 7a, and on Schedule B, Schedule of Contributors, were misstated. The Organization has filed this Form 990 to correct the misstated donations. The net impact of these corrections on the Form 990 are as follows: - Schedule A, Part III, Column (e) 2022, Lina 7a (original): $61,460 - Schedule A, Part III, Column (e) 2022, Lina 7a (amended): $26,355 - Schedule A, Part III, Column (f) Total, Lina 7a (original): $190,102 - Schedule A, Part III, Column (f) Total, Lina 7a (amended): $154,997 - Schedule B, Part I, Total reported contributors who donated greater than over $5,000 (original): $586,925 - Schedule B, Part I, Total reported contributors who donated greater than over $5,000 (amended): $526,820 The Organization has considered its Form 990, Part VIII, Statement of Revenue in coordination with its audited financial statements, and does not believe that the Form 990, Part VIII requires any amendment from its original version due to the change in these donation-figures; the overall total contribution revenue reported on the originally filed Form 990 was based on the Organization's 2022 audited financial statements, which have not been modified or changed since the original Form 990 was filed.
